question:
User Note: KNURSHM is a tracker file variable that was used to build KLBELIG
(Physical Measures eligibility). Please be advised KNURSHM was used because
there is additional evaluation after field period to determine the nursing home
status of respondents, and for this reason KNURSHM was used in place of the
coverscreen variable that controls the flow of the interview.

User Note: Constructed variable from sample management and core data -
designates those respondents who completed questions with an interviewer.
I read a daily newspaper.
I have a hobby or a pastime.
I have taken a vacation within the US in the last 12 months.
I have taken a vacation outside the US in the last 12 months.
I have gone on a daytrip or outing in the last 12 months.
I use the internet and/or email.
I own a cell phone.
None of these statements apply to me.

Not including attendance at religious services, how often do you attend meetings
or programs of groups, clubs, or organizations that you belong to?

description: Q03A. LIFE IS CLOSE TO IDEAL
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with the following statements: In most
ways my life is close to ideal.

description: Q03B. CONDITIONS OF LIFE ARE EXCELLENT
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with the following statements: The
conditions of my life are excellent.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with the following statements: I am
satisfied with my life.

description: Q03D. HAVE IMPORTANT THINGS IN LIFE
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with the following statements: So far,
I have gotten the important things I want in life.

description: Q03E. CHANGE NOTHING IF LIVED LIFE OVER
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with the following statements: If I
could live my life again, I would change almost nothing.

description: Q04. LIVE WITH SPOUSE OR PARTNER
question: Do you have a husband, wife, or partner with whom you live?

description: Q05A. SP/P UNDERSTAND THE WAY YOU FEEL
question:
We would now like to ask you some questions about your partner or spouse. Please
mark the answer which best shows how you feel about each statement. How much do
they really understand the way you feel about things?

description: Q05B. RELY ON SP/P IF SERIOUS PROBLEM
question:
We would now like to ask you some questions about your partner or spouse. Please
mark the answer which best shows how you feel about each statement. How much can
you rely on them if you have a serious problem?

description: Q05C. OPEN UP TO SP/P ABOUT WORRIES
question:
We would now like to ask you some questions about your partner or spouse. Please
mark the answer which best shows how you feel about each statement. How much can
you open up to them if you need to talk about your worries?

description: Q05D. TOO MANY DEMANDS ON YOU - SP/P
question:
We would now like to ask you some questions about your partner or spouse. Please
mark the answer which best shows how you feel about each statement. How often do
they make too many demands on you?

We would now like to ask you some questions about your partner or spouse. Please
mark the answer which best shows how you feel about each statement. How much do
they criticize you?

We would now like to ask you some questions about your partner or spouse. Please
mark the answer which best shows how you feel about each statement. How much do
they let you down when you are counting on them?

description: Q05G. SP/P GETS ON YOUR NERVES
question:
We would now like to ask you some questions about your partner or spouse. Please
mark the answer which best shows how you feel about each statement. How much do
they get on your nerves?
How close is your relationship with your partner or spouse?
Do you have any children?

description: Q08A. CHILDREN UNDERSTAND WAY YOU FEEL
question:
Thinking about all of your living children, please check the answer which best
shows how you feel about each statement. How much do they really understand the
way you feel about things?

description: Q08B. RELY ON CHILDREN IF SERIOUS PROB
question:
Thinking about all of your living children, please check the answer which best
shows how you feel about each statement. How much can you rely on them if you
have a serious problem?

description: Q08C. OPEN UP TO CHILDREN ABOUT WORRIES
question:
Thinking about all of your living children, please check the answer which best
shows how you feel about each statement. How much can you open up to them if you
need to talk about your worries?

description: Q08D.TOO MANY DEMANDS ON YOU - CHILDREN
question:
Thinking about all of your living children, please check the answer which best
shows how you feel about each statement. How often do they make too many demands
on you?

Thinking about all of your living children, please check the answer which best
shows how you feel about each statement. How much do they criticize you?

Thinking about all of your living children, please check the answer which best
shows how you feel about each statement. How much do they let you down when you
are counting on them?

description: Q08G. CHILDREN GET ON YOUR NERVES
question:
Thinking about all of your living children, please check the answer which best
shows how you feel about each statement. How much do they get on your nerves?

On average, how often do you do each of the following with any of your children,
not counting any who live with you? Meet up (include both arranged and chance
meetings)

description: Q09B. SPEAK ON THE PHONE WITH CHILDREN
question:
On average, how often do you do each of the following with any of your children,
not counting any who live with you? Speak on the phone

On average, how often do you do each of the following with any of your children,
not counting any who live with you? Write or email

How many of your children would you say you have a close relationship with?
(Please write a number in the box.)

description: Q11. HAVE ANY OTHER IMMEDIATE FAMILY
question:
Do you have any other immediate family, for example, any brothers or sisters,
parents, cousins or grandchildren?

description: Q12A. OTH FAM MEMBERS UNDERSTAND YOU
question:
On average, how often do you do each of the following with any of these family
members, not counting any who live with you? How much do they really understand
the way you feel about things?

question:
On average, how often do you do each of the following with any of these family

question:

description: Q12E. OTH FAMILY MEMBERS CRITICIZE YOU

question:
On average, how often do you do each of the following with any of these family

description: Q12G. OTH FAM MEMBERS GET ON YOUR NERVES
question:
On average, how often do you do each of the following with any of these family

nerves?

question:
We would now like to ask you some questions about these family members. Please

question:

question:
How many of these family members would you say you have a close relationship

question:
On average, how often do you do each of the following with any of your friends,

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) Most people inwardly dislike putting
themselves out to help other people.

description: Q19B. PEOPLE USE UNFAIR MEANS TO PROFIT
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) Most people will use somewhat unfair means to
gain profit or an advantage rather than lose it.

description: Q19C. NO ONE CARES MUCH WHAT HAPPENS
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) No one cares much what happens to you.

description: Q19D. PEOPLE WOULD LIE TO GET AHEAD
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I think most people would lie in order to get
ahead.

description: Q19E. WONDER WHY OTHERS DO NICE THINGS
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I commonly wonder what hidden reasons another
person may have for doing something nice for me.

description: Q19F. SOMETHING CAN GO WRONG TO ME
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) If something can go wrong for me, it will.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I'm always optimistic about my future.

description: Q19H. EXPECT THE BEST IN UNCERTAIN TIMES
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) In uncertain times, I usually expect the best.

description: Q19I. EXPECT MORE GOOD THINGS TO HAPPEN
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) Overall, I expect more good things to happen
to me than bad.

description: Q19J. HARDLY EXPECT THINGS TO GO MY WAY
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I hardly ever expect things to go my way.

description: Q19K. RARELY COUNT ON GOOD THINGS
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I rarely count on good things happening to me.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I feel it is impossible for me to reach the
goals that I would like to strive for.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) The future seems hopeless to me and I can't
believe that things are changing for the better.

description: Q19N. NOT EXPECT TO GET WHAT I WANT
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I don't expect to get what I really want.

description: Q19O. NO USE IN TRYING TO GET SOMETHING
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) There's no use in really trying to get
something I want because I probably won't get it.

The next questions are about how you feel about different aspects of your life.
For each one, please say how often you feel that way. (Mark (X) one box for each
line.) How often do you feel you lack companionship?

The next questions are about how you feel about different aspects of your life.
For each one, please say how often you feel that way. (Mark (X) one box for each
line.) How often do you feel left out?

The next questions are about how you feel about different aspects of your life.
For each one, please say how often you feel that way. (Mark (X) one box for each
line.) How often do you feel isolated from others?

description: Q21A. FEEL PART OF THIS AREA
question:
These questions ask how you feel about your local area, that is everywhere
within a 20 minute walk or about a mile of your home. Please mark one box on
each line. The closer your mark is to a statement the more strongly you agree
with it. (Mark (X) one box on each line.) I really feel part of this area/I feel
that I don't belong in this area

These questions ask how you feel about your local area, that is everywhere
within a 20 minute walk or about a mile of your home. Please mark one box on
each line. The closer your mark is to a statement the more strongly you agree
with it. (Mark (X) one box on each line.) Vandalism and graffiti are a big
problem in this area/There is no problem with vandalism and graffiti in this
area

description: Q21C. MOST PEOPLE CAN BE TRUSTED
question:
These questions ask how you feel about your local area, that is everywhere
within a 20 minute walk or about a mile of your home. Please mark one box on
each line. The closer your mark is to a statement the more strongly you agree
with it. (Mark (X) one box on each line.) Most people in this area can be
trusted/Most people in this area can't be trusted

description: Q21D. BE AFRAID TO WALK ALONE AFTER DARK
question:
These questions ask how you feel about your local area, that is everywhere
within a 20 minute walk or about a mile of your home. Please mark one box on
each line. The closer your mark is to a statement the more strongly you agree
with it. (Mark (X) one box on each line.) People would be afraid to walk alone
in this area after dark/People feel safe walking alone in this area after dark

description: Q21E. MOST PEOPLE ARE FRIENDLY THIS AREA
question:
These questions ask how you feel about your local area, that is everywhere
within a 20 minute walk or about a mile of your home. Please mark one box on
each line. The closer your mark is to a statement the more strongly you agree
with it. (Mark (X) one box on each line.) Most people in this area are
friendly/Most people in this area are unfriendly

description: Q21F. THIS AREA IS KEPT VERY CLEAN
question:
These questions ask how you feel about your local area, that is everywhere
within a 20 minute walk or about a mile of your home. Please mark one box on
each line. The closer your mark is to a statement the more strongly you agree
with it. (Mark (X) one box on each line.) This area is kept very clean/This area
is always full of rubbish and litter

description: Q21G. PEOPLE  HELP YOU IF IN TROUBLE
question:
These questions ask how you feel about your local area, that is everywhere
within a 20 minute walk or about a mile of your home. Please mark one box on
each line. The closer your mark is to a statement the more strongly you agree
with it. (Mark (X) one box on each line.) If you were in trouble, there are lots
of people in this area who would help you/If you were in trouble, there is
nobody in this area who would help you

description: Q21H. MANY VACANT OR DESERTED HOUSES
question:
These questions ask how you feel about your local area, that is everywhere
within a 20 minute walk or about a mile of your home. Please mark one box on
each line. The closer your mark is to a statement the more strongly you agree
with it. (Mark (X) one box on each line.) There are many vacant or deserted
houses or storefronts in this area/There are no vacant houses or storefronts in
this area

description: Q22A. HOPELESS IN DEALING WITH PROBLEM
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I often feel helpless in dealing with the
problems of life.

description: Q22B. OTHERS DETERMINE WHAT I CAN/NOT DO
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) Other people determine most of what I can and
cannot do.

description: Q22C. LIFE IS BEYOND MY CONTROL
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) What happens in my life is often beyond my
control.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I have little control over the things that
happen to me.

description: Q22E. NO WAY I CAN SOLVE MY PROBLEMS
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) There is really no way I can solve the
problems I have.

description: Q23A. DO ANYTHING I SET MY MIND TO
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I can do just about anything I really set my
mind to.

description: Q23B. USUALLY FIND A WAY TO SUCCEED
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) When I really want to do something, I usually
find a way to succeed at it.

description: Q23C. GET WHAT I WANT IS IN MY OWN HANDS
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) Whether or not I am able to get what I want is
in my own hands.

description: Q23D. THE FUTURE DEPENDS ON ME
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) What happens to me in the future mostly
depends on me.

description: Q23E. DO THINGS THAT I WANT TO DO
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I can do the things that I want to do.

description: Q24. AMOUNT OF CONTROL OVER HEALTH
question:
Using a 0 to 10 scale where 0 means "no control at all" and 10 means "very much
control," how would you rate the amount of control you have over your health
these days? (Circle one number.)

Using a 0 to 10 scale where 0 means "no control at all" and 10 means "very much
control," how would you rate the amount of control you have over your work
situation these days? (Circle one number.)

Using a 0 to 10 scale where 0 means "no control at all" and 10 means "very much
control," how would you rate the amount of control you have over your financial
situation these days? (Circle one number.)

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements:
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I believe in a God who watches over me.

description: Q28B. EVENTS UNFOLD BY A DIVINE PLAN
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements:
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) The events in my life unfold according to a
divine or greater plan.

description: Q28C. TRY HARD TO CARRY OUT BELIEFS
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements:
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I try hard to carry my religious beliefs over
into all my other dealings in life.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements:
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I find strength and comfort in my religion.

description: Q29. PRAY PRIVATELY IN PLACES NOT CHURCH
question: How often do you pray privately in places other than at church or synagogue?

description: Q30A. BE TREATED WITH LESS RESPECT
question:
In your day-to-day life how often have any of the following things happened to
you? You are treated with less courtesy or respect than other people.

description: Q30B. RECEIVE POORER SERVICE THAN OTHERS
question:
In your day-to-day life how often have any of the following things happened to
you? You receive poorer service than other people at restaurants or stores.

description: Q30C. PEOPLE ACT AS IF YOU NOT SMART
question:
In your day-to-day life how often have any of the following things happened to
you? People act as if they think you are not smart.

description: Q30D. PEOPLE ACT AS IF AFRAID OF YOU
question:
In your day-to-day life how often have any of the following things happened to
you? People act as if they are afraid of you.

description: Q30E. YOU ARE THREATENED OR HARASSED
question:
In your day-to-day life how often have any of the following things happened to
you? You are threatened or harassed.

If any of the above have happened to you, what do you think were the reasons why

description: Q35A. ENJOY MAKING PLANS FOR THE FUTURE
question:
Please read the statements below and decide the extent to which each statement
describes you. Mark the box that best describes your agreement or disagreement
with each statement. (Mark (X) one box for each line.) I enjoy making plans for
the future and working to make them a reality.

Please read the statements below and decide the extent to which each statement
describes you. Mark the box that best describes your agreement or disagreement
with each statement. (Mark (X) one box for each line.) My daily activities often
seem trivial and unimportant to me.

description: Q35C. ACTIVE IN CARRYING OUT OWN PLANS
question:
Please read the statements below and decide the extent to which each statement

Think of this ladder as representing where people stand in our society. At the
top of the ladder are the people who are the best off - those who have the most
money, most education, and best jobs. At the bottom are the people who are the
worst off - who have the least money, least education, and the worst jobs or no
jobs. The higher up you are on this ladder, the closer you are to the people at
the very top and the lower you are, the closer you are to the people at the very
bottom.

Please mark an X on the rung on the ladder where you would place yourself.
Has your position on the ladder changed within the last two years?

(Mark (X) one box for each line.) All things considered, I am satisfied with my
job.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) My job is physically demanding.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I receive the recognition I deserve for my
work.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) My salary is adequate.

description: Q50E. JOB PROMOTION PROSPECTS ARE POOR
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) My job promotion prospects are poor.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) My job security is poor.

description: Q50G. PRESSURE DUE TO A HEAVY WORKLOAD
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I am under constant time pressure due to a
heavy workload.

description: Q50H. LITTLE FREEDOM HOW WORK DONE
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I have very little freedom to decide how I do
my work.

description: Q50I. OPPORTUNITY TO DEVELOP NEW SKILLS
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I have the opportunity to develop new skills.

description: Q50J. ADEQUATE SUPPORT IN DIFF SITU
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I receive adequate support in difficult
situations.

description: Q50K. HAVE CONTROL OVER WHAT HAPPENS
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) At work, I feel I have control over what
happens in most situations.

description: Q50L. HAVE TO WORK VERY FAST
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) Considering the things I have to do at work, I
have to work very fast.

description: Q50M. FEEL BOTHERED OR UPSET IN WORK
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) I often feel bothered or upset in my work.

Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) In my work I am free from conflicting demands
that others make.

description: Q50O. JOB INTERFERES WITH PERSONAL LIFE
question:
Please say how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
(Mark (X) one box for each line.) The demands of my job interfere with my
personal life.

Were the questions in this booklet answered by the person whose first name is
written on the front cover, or did someone else provide their own answers? (Mark
(X) one.)
